citations.narrative:
In an enclosure housing four Patagonian cavies, there is a layer of chicken wire lining the inside of the fence. This chicken
wire is crumpled and bent in multiple areas, creating sharp points and places where an animal could become entangled.
Sharp points and entanglement can cause injury to the animals. All housing facilities shall be structurally sound and shall
be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and to contain the animals.

There is an enclosure housing four pigs that are allowed to be fed pellets by the public. Along the inside fence beams for
the enclosure, there is an accumulation of old pellets that are covered in a white fuzzy material.
Inadequate cleaning of areas where food is placed can lead to contamination of food and cause illness in the animals.
Food and food receptacles shall be located as to be accessible to all animals in the enclosure and shall be placed so as
to minimize contamination. Food receptacles and other areas where the public can drop food for the animals shall be kept
clean and sanitary at all times.
To be corrected by September 24, 2023.

In an enclosure housing two rheas, there was a single water receptacle with little to no water present inside. When the
facility representative filled the bucket, both rheas were observed coming over to drink water.
Insufficient quantities of water can cause dehydration and discomfort in the animals. Potable water must be provided in
sufficient quantity to every bird housed at the facility.
To be corrected by September 24, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.125(a)  Repeat
   
Facilities, general. 
In an enclosure housing four Patagonian cavies, there is a layer of chicken wire lining the inside of the fence. This chicken 
wire is crumpled and bent in multiple areas, creating sharp points and places where an animal could become entangled.  
 
Sharp points and entanglement can cause injury to the animals. All housing facilities shall be structurally sound and shall 
be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and to contain the animals. 
3.129(b) 
   
Feeding. 
There is an enclosure housing four pigs that are allowed to be fed pellets by the public. Along the inside fence beams for 
the enclosure, there is an accumulation of old pellets that are covered in a white fuzzy material.  
 
Inadequate cleaning of areas where food is placed can lead to contamination of food and cause illness in the animals. 
Food and food receptacles shall be located as to be accessible to all animals in the enclosure and shall be placed so as 
to minimize contamination. Food receptacles and other areas where the public can drop food for the animals shall be kept 
clean and sanitary at all times.  
 
To be corrected by September 24, 2023. 
3.156 
   
Watering 
In an enclosure housing two rheas, there was a single water receptacle with little to no water present inside. When the 
facility representative filled the bucket, both rheas were observed coming over to drink water. 
 
Insufficient quantities of water can cause dehydration and discomfort in the animals. Potable water must be provided in 
sufficient quantity to every bird housed at the facility.  
 
To be corrected by September 24, 2023.

This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
 n

species.common: DOMESTIC PIG / POTBELLY PIG / MICRO PIG
